name: DonkeyEntityHelper
description: The DonkeyEntityHelper class provides specialized access to donkey entities in Minecraft, including chest management and inventory tracking.
overview:
The `DonkeyEntityHelper` class provides specialized access to donkey entities in Minecraft. Donkeys are passive mobs that can be tamed, ridden, and equipped with chests for storage. This helper extends the functionality of AbstractHorseEntityHelper with donkey-specific features, making it ideal for scripts that manage donkey companions, track storage capabilities, or coordinate donkey-based transportation systems.

This helper is particularly useful for creating scripts that manage donkey inventories, analyze donkey performance statistics, coordinate mounted transport with storage, or track the status of tameable donkey entities in the world. Donkeys serve as excellent pack animals due to their ability to carry chests while maintaining the mobility of horses.

DonkeyEntityHelper instances are not typically created directly by scripters. Instead, they are obtained through entity-related events, world entity queries using type filtering, or casting from generic EntityHelper instances.

methods.name: hasChest
methods.description: Checks whether the donkey currently has a chest equipped. Donkeys with chests have increased inventory capacity.

methods.name: getOwner
methods.description: Gets the UUID of this donkey's owner as a string, or null if it has no owner.

methods.name: isTame
methods.description: Checks if this donkey is already tamed.

methods.name: isAngry
methods.description: Checks if this donkey is angry.

methods.name: isSaddled
methods.description: Checks if this donkey is saddled.

methods.name: canWearArmor
methods.description: Checks if this donkey can wear armor (Returns true/false based on entity capabilities).

methods.name: canBeSaddled
methods.description: Checks if this donkey can be saddled.

methods.name: getInventorySize
methods.description: Gets this donkey's inventory size. Typically 2 slots (saddle + armor slot) without a chest, or 17 slots (1 saddle + 15 storage) with a chest.

methods.name: isBred
methods.description: Checks if this donkey was bred and not naturally spawned.

methods.name: isEating
methods.description: Checks if this donkey is currently eating grass.

methods.name: getJumpStrengthStat
methods.description: Gets this donkey's jump strength attribute value.
examples:
const jumpStrength = donkey.getJumpStrengthStat();
Chat.log(`Jump strength: ${jumpStrength.toFixed(3)}`);

methods.name: getHorseJumpHeight
methods.description: Gets this donkey's maximum jump height for its current jump strength. Result is an approximation close to actual Minecraft behavior.
examples:
const jumpHeight = donkey.getHorseJumpHeight();
Chat.log(`Maximum jump height: ${jumpHeight.toFixed(2)} blocks`);

methods.name: getMaxJumpStrengthStat
methods.description: The maximum possible value of a donkey's jump strength (always returns 1).
examples:
const maxJump = donkey.getMaxJumpStrengthStat();
Chat.log(`Maximum possible jump strength: ${maxJump}`);

methods.name: getMinJumpStrengthStat
methods.description: The minimum possible value of a donkey's jump strength (always returns 0.4).
examples:
const minJump = donkey.getMinJumpStrengthStat();
Chat.log(`Minimum possible jump strength: ${minJump.toFixed(1)}`);

methods.name: getSpeedStat
methods.description: Gets this donkey's speed attribute value.
examples:
const speedStat = donkey.getSpeedStat();
Chat.log(`Speed stat: ${speedStat.toFixed(4)}`);

methods.name: getHorseSpeed
methods.description: Gets this donkey's speed in blocks per second.
examples:
const speed = donkey.getHorseSpeed();
Chat.log(`Movement speed: ${speed.toFixed(2)} blocks per second`);

methods.name: getMaxSpeedStat
methods.description: The maximum possible value of a donkey's speed stat (always returns 0.3375).
examples:
const maxSpeed = donkey.getMaxSpeedStat();
Chat.log(`Maximum possible speed stat: ${maxSpeed.toFixed(4)}`);

methods.name: getMinSpeedStat
methods.description: The minimum possible value of a donkey's speed stat (always returns 0.1125).
examples:
const minSpeed = donkey.getMinSpeedStat();
Chat.log(`Minimum possible speed stat: ${minSpeed.toFixed(4)}`);

methods.name: getHealthStat
methods.description: Gets this donkey's health stat (equal to getMaxHealth()).
examples:
const health = donkey.getHealthStat();
Chat.log(`Health: ${health} hearts`);

methods.name: getMaxHealthStat
methods.description: The maximum possible value of a donkey's health stat (always returns 30).
examples:
const maxHealth = donkey.getMaxHealthStat();
Chat.log(`Maximum possible health: ${maxHealth} hearts`);

methods.name: getMinHealthStat
methods.description: The minimum possible value of a donkey's health stat (always returns 15).
examples:
const minHealth = donkey.getMinHealthStat();
Chat.log(`Minimum possible health: ${minHealth} hearts`);
